intro: Ceropegia caudata subsp. rhodesiaca, commonly known as the Rhodesian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among species in the Asclepiadaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate sunlight, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor cultivation. Its ornamental value and unique floral structure make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
